options.text:
PREREQUISITES REQUIRED 

There are prerequisites that must be setup in your Azure environment to successfully deploy this AVD Landing Zone Accelerator. Click here to review the prerequisites in the Getting Started guide.

The subscription selected in the 'Project details' section below will be used to deploy all resources. 

The region selected in 'Instance details' section below will be used to deploy the AVD management plane resources (workspace, host pool, and application group, etc.). These resource types are not available in all regions, but they are globally replicated.

The session hosts do not have to be deployed to the same region, therefore you will have the option to select that region on the 'Session Hosts' blade.
Azure AVD Landing Zones will create the resource group hierarchy under the subscriptions with the prefix provided in this step.

elements.name: DeploymentPrefix
elements.label: Deployment prefix
elements.toolTip: Provide a prefix (max 4 characters) for the resource groups and resources created as part of AVD landing zones.

options.text: AVD landing zone accelerator deployment expects identity service to be already available in the current Azure estate.

elements.name: IdentityServiceProvider
elements.label: Identity service provider
elements.toolTip: Identity service provider (ADDS or AADDS) that already exist and will be used for Azure Virtual Desktop.

elements.name: IdentityServiceProviderIntuneEnrollment
elements.label: Enroll VM with Intune
elements.toolTip: If Intune is configured in your Azure AD tenant, you can choose to have the VM automatically enrolled during the deployment by selecting Yes.

elements.name: IdentityDomainName
elements.label: Domain name
elements.toolTip: Provide identity service domain name.

options.text: Identity service provider must already exist, as they are a prerequisite for the AVD LZA deployment.

elements.name: IdentityAccessTypes
elements.label: Identity type
elements.toolTip: Select the type of identities that will be entered in the 'Identities ObjectIDs' field.

elements.name: IdentityAccessIds
elements.label: Identities ObjectIDs
elements.toolTip: Comma separated list of identities (ObjectIDs) to be granted access to AVD published items and to create sessions on VMs and single sign-on (SSO) when using AAD as identity provider.

elements.name: IdentityDomainJoinUserName
elements.label: Username
elements.toolTip: Provide username with permissions to join session host to the domain.

elements.name: IdentityDomainJoinUserPassword
elements.toolTip: Provide password for domain join account.

elements.name: IdentityLocalUserName
elements.label: Username
elements.toolTip: Provide username for session host local admin account.

toolTip.password: The password must be alphanumeric, contain at least 12 characters, have at least 1 letter,1 number and 1 special character.

options.text: Host pool type can not be changed after deployment.

elements.name: loadBalancerType
elements.label: Load balancing algorithm
elements.toolTip: Breadth-first load balancing distributes new user sessions across all available session hosts in the host pool. Depth-first load balancing distributes new user sessions to an available session host with the highest number of connections but has not reached its maximum session limit threshold.

allowedValues.label: BreadthFirst
allowedValues.description: Each new user is placed on the next VM. (Performance Optimized)

allowedValues.label: DepthFirst
allowedValues.description: Each new user is placed on the same VM until max sessions limit. (Cost Optimized)

elements.name: maxSessions
elements.label: Max session limit
elements.toolTip: The maximum number of users that have concurrent sessions on a session host. When setting a host pool to have depth first load balancing or planning to use Autoscaling, you must set an appropriate max session limit according to the configuration of your deployment and capacity of your VMs.

elements.name: assignmentType
elements.label: Machine assignment
elements.toolTip: Automatic assignment – The service will select an available host and assign it to an user. Direct assignment – Admin selects a specific host to assign to an user.

allowedValues.label: Automatic (Recommended)
allowedValues.description: Users are assigned an available VM the first time they connect.

allowedValues.label: Direct
allowedValues.description: An administrator assigns a VM for each individual user.

elements.name: ManagementPlaneAppGroupOptions
elements.label: Application group options (Desktop application group will be deployed by default)

elements.name: DeployRappGroup
elements.label: Create remote app group
elements.toolTip: This application group type allows to publish seamless apps instead of full desktops.

elements.name: ScalingPlan
elements.label: AVD scaling plan
elements.toolTip: Will automatically manage session host power state based on usage and schedules (weekdays and weekend schedules will be created).

elements.name: startVmOnConnect
elements.label: Start VM on connect
elements.toolTip: If powered off, start VM once user connects.

elements.name: createVmRole
elements.label: Create start VM on connect role
elements.defaultValue: Yes (Required if using Start VM On Connect)
elements.toolTip: Create custom Azure IAM role for Start VM on Connect

allowedValues.label: Yes (Required if using Start VM On Connect)

elements.name: EnterApplication
elements.label: AVD enterprise application ObjectID
elements.toolTip: Provide the ObjectID of the enterprise application Azure Virtual Desktop (Name can also be displayed as 'Windows Virtual Desktops'). To get the ObjectID got to Azure AD > Enterprise applications, remove all filters and search for 'Virtual Desktops' and copy the OjectID that is paired with the Application ID: 9cdead84-a844-4324-93f2-b2e6bb768d07.

options.text: Session hosts can be excluded from the scaling plan by assigning the tag name Exclude-avdScalingPlanName, if not using custom resource naming and example of default tag name is Exclude-vdscaling-eus2-app1-001.

Start VM on Connect will not work without a custom role definition. If you enable start on connect, but do not specify a custom role VM's will not start on-demand. Only select no if this custom role already exists and is assigned to your AVD subscription.

elements.name: DeploySessionHosts
elements.label: Deploy session hosts
elements.toolTip: Create session hosts compute and storage resources.

elements.name: SessionHostsRegionSection
elements.label: Region Settings
elements.tooltip: The section allows you to specify the region where the compute, storage, and key vault resources are deployed.

elements.name: SessionHostsRegion
elements.label: Session Hosts Region
elements.toolTip: Select the region where the session hosts and required resources are to be deployed.

elements.name: SessionHostsComputeStorageSection
elements.label: General settings
elements.tooltip: This settings apply to compute, storage, image management and key vault resources.

elements.name: IdentityDomainOuPath
elements.label: Session hosts OU path (Optional)
elements.toolTip: Provide OU where to locate session hosts, if not provided session hosts will be placed on the default (computers) OU.

elements.name: SessionHostsAvailabilitySettings
elements.label: Use availability zones
elements.toolTip: Distribute compute resources across availability zones. If 'No' is selected then an availability set will be created to host the VMs.

options.text: FSLogix for Azure AD joined session hosts is currently not globally available (GA).

elements.name: FslogixDeployment
elements.label: Use FSLogix profile management
elements.toolTip: Deploys FSLogix containers and session host setup for user's profiles.

elements.name: IdentityDomainOuPathBool
elements.label: Create OU for storage (fslogix)
elements.toolTip: It is recommended to create a new AD Organizational Unit (OU) in AD and disable password expiration policy on computer accounts or service logon accounts accordingly.

elements.name: IdentityDomainOuPathStorage
elements.label: New storage OU name
elements.toolTip: OU will be created and used to locate storage account file share.

elements.name: IdentityDomainOuPathStorageExisting
elements.label: Existing storage OU path (Optional)
elements.toolTip: Provide OU where to locate storage account file share, if not provided session hosts will be placed on the default (computers) OU.

elements.name: StorageAccountSku
elements.label: File share sku
elements.toolTip: Storage account SKU for FSLogix storage. Recommended tier is Premium_ZRS when avaiable otherwise Premium_LRS.

elements.name: SessionHostsFslogixFileShareQuota
elements.label: File share size
elements.toolTip: Size of Azure File share quota, the maximum sizes are 5TB for standard SKU and 100TB for premium SKU

elements.name: SessionHostsCount
elements.label: VM count
elements.toolTip: Provide the number of session hosts to deploy (1-49).

constraints.validationMessage: The count must be between 1-49 session hosts.

elements.name: SessionHostDiskType
elements.label: OS Disk type
elements.toolTip: Select session host disk type to host the OS.

options.text: Encryption at host requires feature EncryptionAtHost of resource provider Microsoft.Compute to be registered in the subscription.

elements.name: SessionHostsImageSource
elements.label: OS image source
elements.toolTip: Select marketplace or build custom image to deploy the session hosts.

elements.name: SessionHostsOsImage
elements.label: OS version
elements.toolTip: Select the operating system version of the session hosts.

options.text: Setting the Security Type to anything other than 'Standard' requires that the Azure Compute Gallery Image Definition be configured with the Security Type feature set to the appropriate value. You can determine if the image definition supports the required feature by reviewing the 'Properties' tab on the 'Overview' node of the Gallery Image Definition in the portal. If the image definition does not contain these feature options, then the deployment will fail.

elements.name: securityType
elements.label: Security type
elements.toolTip: Choose a type of security that matches your needs: Standard includes basic protections at no additional cost. Trusted launch virtual machines provide additional security features on Gen2 virtual machines to protect against persistent and advanced attacks.

elements.name: secureBootEnabled
elements.label: Enable secure boot
elements.toolTip: Secure boot helps protect your VMs against boot kits, rootkits, and kernel-level malware.

elements.name: vTpmEnabled
elements.label: Enable vTPM
elements.toolTip: Virtual Trusted Platform Module (vTPM) is TPM2.0 compliant and validates your VM boot integrity apart from securely storing keys and secrets.

options.text: AVD landing zone accelerator requires connectivity to identity services (ADDS, AADDS or AAD).

elements.name: VnetSize
elements.label: vNet address range
elements.toolTip: Virtual network for AVD virtual machines

constraints.validationMessage: Invalid CIDR range. The address prefix must be in the range 10 to 24.

elements.name: VnetSubnetSize
elements.label: Subnet address prefix
elements.toolTip: Virtual network subnet for AVD virtual machines

constraints.validationMessage: Invalid CIDR range. The address prefix must be in the range 10 to 24.

elements.name: VnetDns
elements.label: Custom DNS Servers
elements.toolTip: Enter multiple IPs separated by a comma, if not provided Azure provided DNS will be used. Azure default DNS server (168.63.129.16) will be added as a last resort.

options.text: Existing network must has connectivity to identity and DNS services.

elements.name: VnetSubnetSelectorName
elements.label: Subnet
elements.toolTip: Select the subnet.

options.text: Private endpoint network policy needs to be disabled on the existing subnet before deploying AVD accelerator.

elements.name: VnetPrivateDnsZone
elements.label: Azure private DNS zone (Private endpoints)
elements.toolTip: It is recommended to use Azure private DNS zones for private endpoint name spaces (ALZ recommended and deployed).

options.text: vNet peering will be created to existing vNet hub with access to identity and DNS services .
vNet peering to identity services is not required when joining VMs to Azure AD .

elements.name: HubVnetGateway
elements.label: Gateway on hub
elements.toolTip: This information will be used to set remote gateway settings on vNet peering.

elements.name: DeployMonitoring
elements.label: Deploy monitoring
elements.toolTip: Deploy monitoring settings and if selected deploy Azure log analytics workspace.

options.text: Azure Virtual Desktop monitoring requires an existing Azure Log Analytics Workspace or the creation of a new one.

elements.name: DeployMonitoringAlaWorkspace
elements.label: Log analytics workspace
elements.toolTip: Deploy monitoring settings and if selected deploy Azure log analytics workspace.

elements.name: DeployMonitoringNewAlaWorkspaceRetention
elements.label: Retention policy (Days)
elements.toolTip: Number of days data will be retained in the workspace.

elements.name: DeployMonitoringPolicies
elements.label: Deploy monitoring policies (subscription level)
elements.toolTip: Deploy monitoring policy and policy set definitions to set diagnostic settings on new deployed resources.

options.text: Deployment will configured all required settings to use the AVD insights workbook.
The AVD accelerator provides automated resource naming based on Microsoft best practices, default resources organization and naming is shown in this diagram.

options.text: When using custom naming for resources, please make sure to follow naming rules and restrictions for Azure resources.

elements.name: ResourceTaggingSelection
elements.label: Create resource tags
elements.toolTip: When set 'Yes', the information provided will be used to create tags on resources and resource groups.

options.text: By default, all resources will be tagged with parent resource cost management tag (cm-resource-parent). This will group all costs under the host pool resource.

elements.name: TagsWorkloadName
elements.label: Workload name:
elements.toolTip: This input will be the value of a tag named WorkloadName.

elements.name: TagsWorkloadType
elements.label: Workload type:
elements.toolTip: This input will be the value of a tag named WorkloadType, reference to the size of the VM for your workloads.

elements.name: TagsDataClassificationTag
elements.label: Data classification:
elements.toolTip: This input will be the value of a tag named DataClassification, reference to the sensitivity of data hosted.

elements.name: TagsDepartmentTag
elements.label: Department:
elements.toolTip: This input will be the value of a tag named Department, reference the department that owns the deployment.

elements.name: TagsCriticalityTag
elements.label: Workload criticality:
elements.toolTip: This input will be the value of a tag named Criticality, reference to the criticality of the workload.

elements.name: TagsCustomWorkloadCriticality
elements.label: Custom workload criticality:
elements.toolTip: This input will be the value of a tag named Criticality, reference to a custom criticality for the workload.

elements.name: TagsApplicationNameTag
elements.label: Application name:
elements.toolTip: This input will be the value of a tag named ApplicationName, reference details about the application.

elements.name: TagsWorkloadSlaTag
elements.label: Workload SLA:
elements.toolTip: This input will be the value of a tag named ServiceClass, reference to the service level agreement level of the worload.

elements.name: TagsOpsTeamTag
elements.label: Operations team:
elements.toolTip: This input will be the value of a tag named OpsTeam, reference to the team accountable for day-to-day operations.

elements.name: TagsOwnerTag
elements.label: Owner:
elements.toolTip: This input will be the value of a tag named Owner, reference to the organizational owner of the AVD deployment.

elements.name: TagsCostCenterTag
elements.label: Cost center:
elements.toolTip: This input will be the value of a tag named CostCenter, reference to the cost center of owner team.

elements.name: TagsEnvironmentTypeTag
elements.label: Environment type:
elements.toolTip: This input will be the value of a tag named Environment, reference to the environment type of the workload.
